title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

01:27 <qwebirc6865> has joined #xwiki  
01:27 <qwebirc6865> I want to contribute in Xwiki.can anybody tell me how to proceed?  
01:30 <+cjdelisle> you could look at the bug tracker on jira.xwiki.org and see if there's anything which you want to try fixing.  
01:33 <prapia> has quit  
01:33 <qwebirc6865> cjdelisle:and sir,there is the idea "Ajax form editor".I have worked previously on similiar project "automatic form generation".In that project,web-form could be generated by editing a config file.is "Ajax form generator" same idea?  
01:35 <+cjdelisle> I don't know.  
01:36 <+cjdelisle> Sorry to run out but I'm just off to bed now. You will find more developers around tomorrow, about 8 hours from now.  
01:39 <qwebirc6865> ok,sure

03:16 <cpels> Hi All  
03:18 <cpels> wasn´t even expecting to find this many people online at this time. this appears by all indications to be a vibrant community. felling glad wanting to be a part of it  
03:20 <cpels> I have been going through the development wiki, and was wondering perhaps i will get some fast response here. the question is regard to which artifacts to check out to begin with xwiki. I am interesting in one of the Summer of code projects - Android Lib

07:58 <vmassol> cool

11:21 <mayanks43> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <vmassol> tmortagne: thanks for fixing the XEM build  
11:27 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I think I'm all done now, waiting for ci build  
11:32 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
11:33 <+tmortagne> vmassol: btw it's very nice they added colors in build log in jenkins  
11:33 <vmassol> didn't notice  
11:33 <+tmortagne> (maybe was is last hudson version we were using don't remember)  
11:33 <+tmortagne> you don't see colors in http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-reporting-tool-daily/126/console ?  
11:33 <+tmortagne> for warning and errors  
11:33 <vmassol> yes I can see them  
11:33 <vmassol> I hadn't noticed (or I didn't remember)  
11:34 <vmassol> nice  
11:34 <+tmortagne> make easier to find the issue  
11:35 <+tmortagne> now they need to had automatic link to the source on stack trace and it's perfect :D  
11:35 <vmassol> isn't there a hudson (s/hudson/jenkins/) plugin for IDEs?  
11:36 <+tmortagne> no idea  
11:36 <+tmortagne> never though about that actually  
11:36 <+tmortagne> checking eclipse repo  
11:37 <+tmortagne> only found http://marketplace.eclipse.org/content/hudson-status?mpc=true&mpc\_state=  
11:37 <+tmortagne> which could be useful already  
11:38 <lucaa> has quit  
11:54 <+tmortagne> someone added an input field without associated <label> recently (like yesterday) ? See http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/487/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards/CustomDutchWebGuidelinesValidationTest/Validating\_Dutch\_Web\_Guidelines\_validity\_for\_\_space\_Main\_\_page\_WebHome\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/  
11:56 <+tmortagne> looks like to be <input class="targetName withTip" name="targetName" size="15" type="text" value="Name">  
11:57 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: I think it's for you, i can visibility stiff around it  
11:57 <+tmortagne> s/can/can see/  
11:59 <+cjdelisle> Is anyone using xwiki-reporting-tool-daily? I've found it helpful at times but generally I just /dev/null all of the hudson mail and check the site if I want to know anything.  
11:59 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: i generally do website checking sessions  
11:59 <+tmortagne> but i looks at ci mail failing on core usually  
12:00 <+tmortagne> since it's supposed to be rare  
12:00 <+tmortagne> or at least important stuff  
12:00 <+tmortagne> but i don't look at the mail detail  
12:00 <+tmortagne> it's just something to warn me to go to the website and check  
12:01 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: I'll fix it  
12:01 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: ok  
12:02 <+cjdelisle> heh if you go to the site every time you get hudson mail you'd never leave.  
12:02 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: not with core  
12:02 <+cjdelisle> oh I see  
12:02 <+tmortagne> it does not fail that much except theses day with all the move around  
12:03 <+tmortagne> will do the same with commons and rendering now i guess  
12:03 <+tmortagne> but there is no real rule :)  
12:04 <+cjdelisle> If nobody's using the reports then I might aswell shut it down. I'm not quite sure how to represent important failures with so many flickers and "unimportant failures"  
12:05 <+tmortagne> well there should no be unimportant failures in theory but too many people commit XE stuff without looking at the integration test result  
12:05 <@sdumitriu> Goal: 3.0 final should have all tests passing  
12:05 <@sdumitriu> For good  
12:05 <@sdumitriu> So that only real problems cause the build to fail  
12:06 <vmassol> the problem is that when someone commits somethinghe doesn't fix the functional tests at the same time  
12:06 <vmassol> so they keep failling and people then don't look at mails  
12:06 <vmassol> and new failing tests slip in  
12:07 <+cjdelisle> The problem with checking integration tests is that the build time is so long.  
12:07 <vmassol> cjdelisle: it's ok to let jenkins check  
12:07 <vmassol> but a fialing tests should not stay for more than say, 1 day  
12:07 <vmassol> s/tests/test/  
12:07 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: sure but pople that committed XE stiff never look at ci website after that even one day after  
12:08 <vmassol> lunch time bbl  
12:09 <+tmortagne> yea me too  
12:09 <+cjdelisle> If it's a common occurence and not just one or two people then I'd say "don't blame the people, blame the process"  
12:10 <+tmortagne> core have the same process and you don't have all theses test failing so I'm not sure it's all process fault  
12:11 <+cjdelisle> You mean re unit tests?  
12:20 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle:  i mean i never rebuild the whole core each time i touch something so sometimes ci build find break i did but I always fix it quickly  
12:21 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I see that our pages are rendered in quirks mode in IE6. Is this something new? My problem is that I'm relying on prototype.js to get the viewport dimensions and I get width:0 heigth:0 because https://prototype.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8886/tickets/488-documentviewportgetdimensions-returns-0-with-ie6-documentcompatmodecss1compat and they say "Prototype, like most other frameworks, does not officially support quirksmode. We are closing this ticke  
12:21 <+cjdelisle> I'll let you get to your lunch, we can chat about this later.  
12:22 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: No, it's always been quirks mode  
12:22 <@sdumitriu> Because of the <?xml declaration  
12:23 <+mflorea> yes, but I though it was commented out  
12:23 <+mflorea> at some point  
12:23 <+mflorea> but maybe in some of my templates, not in htmlheader.vm  
12:25 <@sdumitriu> We should switch to HTML5 doctype  
12:25 <+mflorea> now, if we depend on prototype.js and it doesn't support IE6 quirks mode and out pages are rendered in quirks mode what's the best practice for writing cross-browser JS in this case?..  
12:25 <@sdumitriu> I had the same problem  
12:25 <@sdumitriu> I did a manual test  
12:25 <@sdumitriu> Something like, IIRC:  
12:25 <@sdumitriu> use getWidth  
12:26 <@sdumitriu> if 0, use the other thing that IE6 knows  
12:26 <@sdumitriu> contentWidth was it?  
12:26 <@sdumitriu> It was a long time ago  
12:27 <+mflorea> I need the viewport dimensions, I'll do as you say, and fallback on IE6 specific code  
12:27 <AbhijitKane> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <+jvelociter> new image diff on github : http://bit.ly/fcweu3  
12:29 <+jvelociter> that's the ultimate way of cheating at 7 differences !  
12:32 <Avipar1> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: MessageStream improvements committed, can you stir it a bit?  
12:39 <vmassol> I'm rebuilding too  
12:39 <+cjdelisle> Does the script that dumps logs when the wiki is unresponsive start recording logs when it issues the quit signal?  
12:39 <+cjdelisle> From the logs I see, it looks like it is abridged.

13:15 <@sdumitriu> Sure  
13:15 <+sburjan`> wannt to finish with the MTR :)

14:05 <AbhijitKane> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <AbhijitKane> has quit  
14:08 <evalica> has quit  
14:08 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <@sdumitriu> http://patft.uspto.gov/netacgi/nph-Parser?Sect1=PTO1&Sect2=HITOFF&d=PALL&p=1&u=%2Fnetahtml%2FPTO%2Fsrchnum.htm&r=1&f=G&l=50&s1=6,339,780.PN.&OS=PN/6,339,780&RS=PN/6,339,780  
14:13 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <evalica> has quit  
14:14 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: there are serious issues with the user message form in inline mode, on IE  
14:14 <+lucaa> the buttons don't work anymore  
14:14 <+lucaa> it's because IE understands wrongly that when the first form is closed, all the forms are closed  
14:14 <@sdumitriu> Yes, those should be removed  
14:14 <+lucaa> this makes editing dashboards fail  
14:14 <+lucaa> do you wanna take care of it?  
14:14 <@sdumitriu> It doesn't make sense to have the message submit in inline mode  
14:14 <+lucaa> or should I?  
14:15 <@sdumitriu> I'll do it  
14:15 <@sdumitriu> Can you rename the dashboard class? :)  
14:15 <+lucaa> ok, thanks a lot  
14:15 <+lucaa> rename the dashboard?  
14:15 <@sdumitriu> (it was already on my list)  
14:15 <+lucaa> you mean the one generated by the dashboard macro?  
14:15 <@sdumitriu> See the mail for changing "colortheme" to "panels"  
14:15 <+lucaa> ah, wait  
14:15 <+lucaa> lemme check the mail  
14:16 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
14:17 <qwebirc90438> I want to contribute in "Ajax form Editor".I have done a project very similiar to this.could anyone tell me how to proceed?  
14:22 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: ok, I could change it to panels, hope no one will be -1...  
14:23 <+lucaa> if we do it now, before the RC1 release, would we have to take migration into account?  
14:24 <+lucaa> knowing that no document in the enterprise .xar uses that...  
14:24 <@sdumitriu> No  
14:26 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: do we have a spacer 1x1 image in our skins? I can't find one.  
14:26 <@sdumitriu> No  
14:26 <+mflorea> ok, thanks  
14:28 <+lucaa> mflorea: when is the RC release? do I have time to implement the new style name for the dashboard? (knowing that I need to change css + all translations of the field description)  
14:29 <@sdumitriu> Probably tomorrow morning  
14:30 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <+mflorea> yes, I want to fix two bugs before the release. (1) The gallery macro doesn't work on IE6 (including XWIKI-6143) and (2) XWIKI-6121  
14:31 <+mflorea> plus, there are selenium  tests failing that need to be fixed.  
14:32 <+lucaa> ok mflorea, thanks  
14:34 <vmassol> jvelociter: hi  
14:34 <vmassol> I think what you said yesterday is not correct  
14:34 <+jvelociter> what did I say ?  
14:34 <vmassol> the problem I have is a build time issue on my mac  
14:35 <vmassol> not a runtime one  
14:35 <vmassol> if I use a version built by jenkins it works for me, annotations work for ex  
14:35 <vmassol> if I build it locally it doesn't work  
14:35 <vmassol> I've just rebuilt the whole XE  
14:35 <+jvelociter> that's interesting  
14:35 <vmassol> and for example annotations don't work  
14:35 <+jvelociter> well, the scripts are compiled at runtime that's for sure  
14:36 <+jvelociter> but maybe it's a consequence of a build time issue  
14:36 <vmassol> they're also compiled at build time for some of them  
14:36 <+jvelociter> not annotations  
14:36 <+jvelociter> that's for sure  
14:36 <+jvelociter> :)  
14:36 <vmassol> right now I'm talking about hte js part that adds the annotation menu  
14:37 <vmassol> do you know where this is located?  
14:37 <+jvelociter> yes and I'm telling you that's not minified at build time  
14:37 <+jvelociter> it's jsx/AnnotationsCode/Script  
14:37 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: would it make sense to discuss whether the name of the style should be "panels" (plural) or "panel" singular?  
14:37 <+jvelociter> i.e. AnnotationCode.Script in object edition mode  
14:37 <vmassol> "Annotation Javascript -- Annotation application" this one?  
14:38 <+jvelociter> vmassol: FYI this is compiled in com.xpn.xwiki.web.sx.JsExtension around line 90  
14:38 <+jvelociter> the exact line being compressor.compress(out, -1, true, false, false, false);  
14:38 <+jvelociter> vmassol: yes this one  
14:38 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
14:38 <ihalip> has quit  
14:38 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <jstoldt|Notebook> has quit  
14:39 <+jvelociter> vmassol: would be interesting to diff your WEB-INF/lib/ between jenkins build and own build  
14:39 <vmassol> yep I can do that  
14:40 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <vmassol> ok there's only 1 difference in non xwiki jars:  batik-js-1.7.jar  
14:43 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: we have an issue with the "panels" name, it collides with the class name of the panels columns, and I don't know how to write the css so that they don't interfere  
14:43 <vmassol> I have it locally but it's not in the jenkins build I have downloaded (downloaded from yesterday so it could have been added)  
14:43 <vmassol> let me try to remove it locally  
14:45 <vmassol> miracle…. it works now  
14:45 <vmassol> double checking  
14:46 <+lucaa> vmassol: I just checked, I don't have it on a build that I have done locally (core, web, enterprise)  
14:46 <+lucaa> and of course, it works  
14:47 <vmassol> confired  
14:47 <vmassol> confirmed  
14:47 <vmassol> it's this jar causing the problem  
14:47 <vmassol> now let's see if I can find out why I get it  
14:47 <vmassol> @lucaa: are you using maven3?  
14:47 <+lucaa> vmassol: no  
14:48 <vmassol> ahah  
14:48 <vmassol> jenkins is also using maven 2.2.1  
14:48 <vmassol> checking dependency:tree  
14:52 <vmassol> interesting: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MSHARED-167  
14:53 <vmassol> "Possibly related is that Maven 2.2.1 also fails to find batik-js in MavenProject.getRuntimeArtifacts, so clean package fails, whereas this works fine under Maven 3.0."  
14:53 <vmassol> so thanks to a bug in maven 2.2.1 it's not packaged it seems  
14:54 <vmassol> next step is to find out why batik-js is causing problems in yuicompressor  
14:54 <prapia> has joined #xwiki  
14:54 <vmassol> let's see what's insde....  
14:54 <@sdumitriu> batik-js also bundles rhino  
14:54 <vmassol> org.mozilla.javascript  
14:54 <@sdumitriu> I think there are 3 rhino versions in the classpath  
14:55 <vmassol> I don't see rhino in it  
14:55 <vmassol> unless org.mozilla.javascript is rhino  
14:55 <@sdumitriu> Yep, that's it  
14:55 <vmassol> ok so here we have the explanation  
14:55 <vmassol> :)  
14:55 <vmassol> cool so we can esasily exclude it  
14:55 <@sdumitriu> +1  
14:56 <vmassol> ok doing this  
15:00 <+jvelociter> cool  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> The correct thing to do is for yui to rename the package  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> How's that called? Sharding?  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> shadowing?  
15:01 <vmassol> the maven plugin is the shade plugin  
15:01 <vmassol> shading  
15:02 <@sdumitriu> Yep, that's the one  
15:02 <vmassol> it's called relocation  
15:02 <vmassol> package relocation  
15:03 <@sdumitriu> Since they use modified versions of the library, it's normal to relocate it  
15:03 <vmassol> oh they modify it?  
15:03 <vmassol> that's bad  
15:03 <vmassol> in that case yes it becomes their own  
15:06 <harshanianu\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:10 <lucaa> has quit  
15:15 <vmassol> sdumitriu: would you know why batik-js bundles rhino btw?  
15:15 <vmassol> ok I know  
15:15 <vmassol> "This is a patched version of Rhino 1.6R5 for use by Batik. See http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/xmlgraphics/batik/trunk/lib/README.js.txt for details of the patch."  
15:15 <vmassol> so this means we may have a problem with FOP  
15:16 <vmassol> since it needs batik which requires this patched version  
15:16 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:17 <jstoldt> hey  
15:17 <jstoldt> is it just me or does the icon for Network a little nasty?  
15:17 <vmassol> maybe Rhino 1.7R2 has the patch included, checking  
15:18 <vmassol> hmm swinggui ...  
15:18 <vmassol> shouldn't impact us  
15:19 <vmassol> (it's in the rhino debugger)  
15:19 <vmassol> pfew  
15:19 <vmassol> :)  
15:23 <+tmortagne> vmassol: btw we still get com.xpn.xwiki.platform:xwiki-web-gwt-wysiwyg-server war in the classpath, just remember it now  
15:24 <+tmortagne> looks like is added as a jar in WEB-INF/lib  
15:24 <+tmortagne> even if the pom.xml say war  
15:24 <+tmortagne> if it's working as a jar we should probably make it a real jar project then  
15:24 <+tmortagne> mflorea: WDYT ?  
15:24 <+tmortagne> (would be easier for web-web-debug ;))  
15:25 <+tmortagne> this project actually looks a lot like a jar  
15:26 <harshanianu> has joined #xwiki  
15:26 <harshanianu\_> has quit  
15:27 <+mflorea> tmortagne: xwiki-web-gwt-wysiwyg-server generates multiple artifacts, the war is the main one, but there is a jar inside it also. The war also includes resources for the client side of the wysiwyg editor  
15:27 <+mflorea> you can't make it a jar
